thread.title: Author Ernest Lawson Jr. Substantiates Validity of Verbiage Accuracy
thread.title_full: Author Ernest Lawson Jr. Substantiates Validity of Verbiage Accuracy

author: Marketing Services
title: Author Ernest Lawson Jr. Substantiates Validity of Verbiage Accuracy
text:
A new review from The US Review of Books applauds author Ernest Lawson Jr .’s stalwart courage. Utilizing his study of chronological events that overtly betided in America, Lawson assertively substantiates the validity of popular and unpopular memorable occurrences, advertised in his book “ Political Bias Distortion, Based on Philosophical Agendas ” (published by Trafford Publishing). In essence, the author is a native of America, born with African genetic heritage in the state of Alabama during the 1930s. His philosophical ideology – which was taught at approximately age 5 or 6 – is to adhere to the system of established laws relative to the constitution, and to always view all ethnicities of people, in an effort to establish creditability – especially one’s ethnic heritage. However, courageousness is not without corollary, pertaining to people eternally.
Pertaining to politics, Lawson indicates that numerous within the general public may not understand the central importance of his devoted research on chronological events that transpired in the United States of America and abroad, based on his profound knowledge from approximately 60 years of life.
“God created Mankind with a brain that automatically externalizes human procedure,” Lawson says, “based on nation of genetic heritage, of born origin eternally.”
“Political Bias Distortion, Based on Philosophical Agendas”
By Ernest Lawson Jr.
Hardcover | 6 x 9 in | 248 pages | ISBN 9781466929029
Softcover | 6 x 9 in | 248 pages | ISBN 9781466929036
E-Book | 248 pages | ISBN 9781466929043
